remarks: A subset of a free module obtained by restricting the support set is a submodule. ` J ` is the set of permitted unit vectors.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Feb-2015.)  Obsolete version of ~ frlmsslss2 as of 23-Jun-2019.  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
frlmsslss.y $e |- Y = ( R freeLMod I ) $.
frlmsslss.u $e |- U = ( LSubSp ` Y ) $.
frlmsslss.b $e |- B = ( Base ` Y ) $.
frlmsslss.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` R ) $.
frlmsslss2OL.c $e |- C = { x e. B | ( `' x " ( _V \ { .0. } ) ) C_ J } $.
frlmsslss2OLD $p |- ( ( R e. Ring /\ I e. V /\ J C_ I ) -> C e. U ) $.
$d .0. x $.
$d B x $.
$d I x $.
$d J x $.
$d R x $.
$d U x $.
$d V x $.
$d Y x $.
